info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 02 at 2:23AM CDT until May 02 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL PARKER AND NORTH CENTRAL HOOD COUNTIES... At 223 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Horseshoe Bend, or 15 miles northwest of Granbury, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Parker and north central Hood Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
